FuncDef:
The e1 channel-set command bundles the timeslots of the E1 channel of a CPOS interface into a channel-set.
The undo e1 channel-set command unbundles the timeslots of the E1 channel of a CPOS interface.
By default, no timeslots of the E1 channel of a CPOS interface are bundled into a channel-set.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the E1 channel number of a CPOS interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 63.

Specifies the number of a channel-set.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 30.

Specifies the timeslot number or the timeslot range.
You can specify either a single timeslot or a range of timeslots. A comma (,) is used to separate timeslots, and a hyphen (-) is used to specify a timeslot range.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 31.

Specifies timeslot 0 to be bundled into a channel-set.
The e1 e1number channel-set setnumber timeslot-list slotbitmask ts0 command bundles timeslot 0 and the timeslots specified by slotbitmask into a channel-set.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the E1 channel of a CPOS interface works in channelized mode, it is divided into 32 timeslots physically. Timeslots 1 to 31 can be bundled into several channel-sets. To bundle the timeslots into a channel-set, run the e1 channel-set command. Each channel-set functions as an interface whose logical features are the same as a synchronous serial interface. The interface serial command allows you to enter the view of the interface that is formed by bundling timeslots.
